title: MIR inlining doesn't work together with MIR validation

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
## STR

tested on commit 1410d5604042b739f02f9ec0f2a6c5125c797d52 on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

```Rust

// option. This file may not be copied, modified, or distributed
// except according to those terms.

fn main() { main2::<()>(); }

fn main2<T>() {
    let c = |_x| {};
    c(&mut 1);
}
```

```
$ rustc validate-fail.rs -Z mir-emit-validate=1 -Z mir-opt-level=2
```

## Expected result
Code compiles

## Actual result

ICE - I think the problem is that `Validate` is restricted to taking a local as an argument, which we can't expand to a closure upvar.
